meanings.definition: A rigid metallic strip or bar used to conduct electricity within a power distribution system.
meanings.sent1: The busbar carried electricity from one place to another in the building.
meanings.sent2: The electrician installed the busbar to ensure all areas received power.
meanings.sent3: When the busbar went on vacation, the lights in the office took a break too!
meanings.sent4: The busbar was the highway of electricity, guiding it through the building's veins.
meanings.sent5: The shiny busbar hummed with energy, lighting up the entire room.

meanings.definition: A component in an electrical panel that connects multiple circuits together.
meanings.sent1: The busbar linked all the circuits in the panel, ensuring smooth electricity flow.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the busbar connections regularly to prevent any disruptions.
meanings.sent3: The busbar threw a party for all the circuits, making sure they were well-connected!
meanings.sent4: In the electrical world, the busbar was the ultimate matchmaker, bringing circuits together.
meanings.sent5: The busbar's job was to unite the circuits, creating a harmonious electrical symphony.
